file.title: File
file.export-scene-final-cut-proX-and-premiere: Export Scene for Final Cut Pro X and Premiere.

help.title: Help
help.bug-submit: Found a bug? Submit an issue!!!

welcome-window.welcome-line-1: Storyboarder simply allows you to visually board your stories as fast as you possibly can.
welcome-window.welcome-line-2: Either work from a written story, or create a completely new board file. Create a board, draw in it, create a board, draw in it, and start to see your story come to life. You can also print out worksheets, draw on them, and easily import them.

light-pencil.title: Light Pencil
light-pencil.description: Draw rough ideas with this tool. Feel free to make mistakes. This tool draws on the reference layer, so you can easily erase these lines.

brush.title: Fill Brush Pen
brush.description: Paint and fill with this tool. The brush pen is a steady stream of ink. This tool draws on the fill layer.

tone.title: Tone Pastel
tone.description: Tone and shade with this tool. This tool draws on the tone layer.

pencil.title: Pencil
pencil.description: Draw and shade details with this tool. It's lighter and softer than the pen. This tool draws on the pencil layer.

pen.title: Ink Marker
pen.description: This tool is for hard thicker lines. Use this tool for final inking and outlining. This tool draws on the ink layer.

note-pen.title: Note Pen
note-pen.description: Revise boards with this tool. Have a note? Draw right on top of the board. This tool draws on the notes layer, so it is easy to erase. This tool draws on the notes layer.

eraser.title: Eraser
eraser.description: Made a mistake? Use the eraser. When holding option (or alt), it will only erase the tool’s layer you’re on. Otherwise, will erase all layers.

current-color.title: Current Color
current-color.description: Click to change the current color.

controls-size.title: Brush Size
controls-size.description: Drag value to increase or decrease the brush size … or just use the key commands like real pros!

controls-stroke-opacity.title: Stroke Opacity
controls-stroke-opacity.description: Drag value to adjust the overall opacity of new strokes.

palette-colorA.title: Palette Color 1
palette-colorA.description: Click to set the current color to this. Hold down to set this color to another.

palette-colorB.title: Palette Color 2
palette-colorB.description: Click to set the current color to this. Hold down to set this color to another.

palette-colorC.title: Palette Color 3
palette-colorC.description: Click to set the current color to this. Hold down to set this color to another.

toolbar-trash.title: Clear Canvas
toolbar-trash.description: Press this to clear the whole drawing! Don't worry! You can always undo.

toolbar-marquee.title: Lasso Tool
toolbar-marquee.description:
Lasso an area of art to manipulate.

Draw to lasso an area. Add to area with SHIFT + draw. Subtract with ALT/OPTION + draw. Press 'f' to fill area with current brush color and opacity. Press DELETE/BACKSPACE to erase area.

Press and hold inside lasso’d area to begin moving, then drag. Fill and erase work after move also.

ENTER to commit. ESCAPE to cancel.

toolbar-undo.title: Undo
toolbar-undo.description: Made a mistake? No problem. You can undo!

toolbar-redo.title: Redo
toolbar-redo.description: Undo too much? You can redo what you've undone.

toolbar-grid.title: Grid Guide
toolbar-grid.description: Toggle a grid used for measured drawings or straight lines.

toolbar-center.title: Center Guide
toolbar-center.description: Toggle centerline guide used to make sure your drawing is centered.

toolbar-thirds.title: Rule of Thirds Guide
toolbar-thirds.description: Toggle thirds guide to center focus on the thirds. Any mediocre cinematographer uses this all the time!

toolbar-perspective.title: 3D Guide
toolbar-perspective.description: Match the 3d grid for your generated shot. If you don't have a generated shot, you get an eye level 3d view. Noiiice.

toolbar-onion.title: Onion Skin
toolbar-onion.description: Toggle display of last and next frame so you can tween shots for transitions and animations.

toolbar-captions.title: Captions
toolbar-captions.description: Toggle dialogue caption overlays on and off.

toolbar-open-in-editor.title: Edit in Photoshop
toolbar-open-in-editor.description: Click here to edit the board in Photoshop. When you're done editing, just save the file in Photoshop. It will update in Storyboarder automatically.

toolbar-pomodoro-rest.title: Sketch Sprint
toolbar-pomodoro-rest.description: Set a timer and record a timelapse of your work.

toolbar-pomodoro-running.title: Sketch Sprint
toolbar-pomodoro-running.description: Set a timer and record a timelapse of your work.

line-mileage.title: Line Mileage
line-mileage.description: As you draw, the line miles for the shot add up. This is useful to know how much you are drawing per shot. Remember, you aren't trying to make the next Moner Lisa. You're just trying to get the idea across.

new-shot-tooltip.title: Is this board a new shot?
new-shot-tooltip.description: Check this box if the board is a new shot. You can have multiple boards per shot. This way you can animate or make a transition in a shot.

duration-ms.title: Set the board duration
duration-ms.description: Enter the number of milliseconds for a board. There are 1000 milliseconds in a second. 2000 milliseconds is the default.

duration-fps.title: Set the board duration
duration-fps.description: Enter the number of frames for a board.

suggested-dialogue-duration.title: Suggested board duration
suggested-dialogue-duration.description: Click to set the duration based on the dialogue text.

dialogue-tooltip.title: Dialogue for board
dialogue-tooltip.description: Write some really sweet dialogue, like, ''As you know, I am your father.'' It will show up as a caption if you have it toggled on.

action-tooltip.title: Action for board
action-tooltip.description: Write some action for the board.

note-tooltip.title: Notes for the board
note-tooltip.description: Write some notes. Could be board notes for changes, or just some notes for the shot.

clear-note-tooltip.title: Clear notes drawing layer
clear-note-tooltip.description: Clear the notes layer for this board. You can also clear it when you are on the notes drawing tool and you press:

remove-audio.title: Remove audio
remove-audio.description: Remove audio reference from this board. The file will remain on disk unless Clean Up Scene is used.

reference-layer-tooltip.title: Clear reference drawing layer
reference-layer-tooltip.description: Clear the reference layer for this board. You can also clear it when you are on the light pencil drawing tool and you press:

merge-down-tooltip.title: Merge the fill layer down to the reference layer
merge-down-tooltip.description: This is useful if you want to take your existing fill layer and redraw for cleanup. This will combine both layers to the reference layer. The fill layer will be blank.

merge-up-tooltip.title: Merge the reference layer up to the fill layer
merge-up-tooltip.description: This is useful if you draw on the reference layer and you want to keep it in your drawing. This will combine both layers to the fill layer. The reference layer will be blank.

layer-opacity-tooltip.title: Merge the reference layer up to the fill layer
layer-opacity-tooltip.description: Change the opacity of the reference layer and Shot Generator layer. You will only be able to see the change if there is a saved Shot Generator shot, or something on the reference layer.

sts-input1.title: Shot Description
sts-input1.description: Describe the shot: for example, medium shot. Press enter to generate a shot image.

sts-select.title: Shot Description Data
sts-select.description: Refine data used to generate shot images.

sts-shots.title: Generated Shot Images
sts-shots.description: Click to refine data for generated shot image. Double-click to use generated shot image as reference layer.

show-in-finder-button.title: Show board in file system
show-in-finder-button.description: Click here to show the board image file in the file system. This is useful for external editors.

prev-scene-tooltip.title: Previous Scene
prev-scene-tooltip.description: If current board is at the start or end of the scene, this will jump backward one scene. Otherwise this will jump to the start of the current scene.

prev-board-tooltip.title: Previous Board
prev-board-tooltip.description: Use the arrow keys to flip between boards quickly to see how the story is flowing.

play-tooltip.title: Play/Pause
play-tooltip.description: This will toggle between playing automatically and not. The playback timing is default 2 seconds per board, or whatever is set as the board duration.

next-board-tooltip.title: Next Board
next-board-tooltip.description: Use the arrow keys to flip between boards quickly to see how the story is flowing.

next-scene-tooltip.title: Next Scene
next-scene-tooltip.description: If current board is at the start or end of the scene, this will jump forward one scene. Otherwise this will jump to the end of the current scene.

common.object-creation-help: How to Create 3D Models for Custom Objects

emotions.emotion-creation-help: How to Create Emotions for Characters

tooltip.title: Add Camera
tooltip.description: Add a new camera in the scene.

tooltip.title: Add Object
tooltip.description: Add a new object. You can change the properties to the left.

tooltip.title: Add Character
tooltip.description: Add a new character in the scene. You can change the pose by dragging the control point spheres around.

tooltip.title: Add Light
tooltip.description: Add a spot light into the scene.

tooltip.title: Add Volume
tooltip.description: Add a volume like rain, fog, explosion.

tooltip.title: Add Image
tooltip.description: Useful for reference images, posters, or matte paintings in your scene. Once added, use the Inspector (at left) to select an image file and set properties. You can also drag and drop an image file onto the scene, or paste an image from the clipboard.

tooltip.title: Open in VR
tooltip.description: Click this to see the address you should type into your VR browser like the Oculus Quest.

tooltip.title: Save to Board
tooltip.description: Save the current shot to the current Storyboard. After you save it, you can close this window.

tooltip.title: Insert As New Board
tooltip.description: Insert the current shot after the current Storyboard. After you insert a new board, you can close this window, or continue to insert more shots.

popup.open-vr: To view, open a VR web browser to
popup.scary-warning:
You may see a scary browser warning message
because VR runs from this computer, not a trusted server.
In Oculus Browser, click “Advanced” and then “Proceed” to accept the self-signed certificate.
Learn more in the {{link}}

roll-camera.title: Roll Camera Angle
roll-camera.description: Rotate the camera around the roll axis to create a dutch angle.

pan-tilt-camera.title: Pan / Tilt Camera Angle
pan-tilt-camera.description: Pan or tilt the camera by clicking and dragging on this control, or clicking and dragging on the 3D viewport. You can also move while clicking and dragging.

move-camera.title: Move Camera
move-camera.description: Move the camera forward, backward, left and right. You can also pan while moving the camera. You can hold shift to move faster.

elevate-camera.title: Elevate Camera
elevate-camera.description: Elevate the camera up and down. You can hold shift to elevate faster.

change-camera-lens.title: Change Camera Lens (Zoom)
change-camera-lens.description: Change the field of view of the camera's lens. If you press the bracket keys, it will snap to standard prime lens angles.

auto-shot-framing.title: Auto Shot Framing
auto-shot-framing.description: Select a character and then select the Shot Size and/or Camera Angle to automatically position the camera to frame the shot.

change-active-camera.title: Change Active Camera
change-active-camera.description: If there are multiple cameras in the scene, you can change the active camera for the shot.

shot-explorer.characters-warning: You need to add at least one built-in character to scene

boards.boards.overwrite-with-vr-changes: Are you sure you want to overwrite with VR changes?
boards.change-without-saving: Are you sure you want to change board without saving?

preferences.title: Preferences
preferences.restart-hint: Please restart Storyboarder to apply changes.
preferences.saving-hint: When disabled, use 'File > Save' to save project data. Note that changes to image data are always saved automatically.
preferences.force-psd-reload: Force reload watched PSD when Storyboarder regains focus
preferences.psd-reload-hint:
Enable if working from a network drive.
Disable to improve performance when switching between
Storyboarder and other apps. When disabled, Storyboarder only
watches PSD files in the background (which is not supported on all computers).
preferences.psd-editor-hint:
Select an application (e.g.: .exe or .app). By default this will be the application associated in your operating system for opening PSD files.
To reset to default, cancel the file prompt.
preferences.reveal-keymap-file-hint:
You can choose which keys are bound to which Storyboarder commands by editing
the Keymap JSON file in a source code editor like Atom or VS Code.
preferences.show-diagnostics-hint: Displays how fast Storyboarder is able to run in frames-per-second over time. Useful for troubleshooting.
preferences.line-delay-hint:
Pause for this long while drawing to switch to straight line mode.
Hold Shift to draw a straight line.
Hold Alt/Option while drawing a straight line to snap angles.
preferences.sounds-hint:
Sounds might slow down Storyboarder on some computers.
You can turn them off for better performance.
preferences.performance-enhancements-hint: Disable these if drawing feels slow.
preferences.high-quality-drawing-engine-hint: When enabled, a higher-quality drawing engine with more advanced brushes is used. When disabled, the (faster) Efficiency Mode drawing engine is used.
preferences.languages-hint: Select a language, or create your own.
preferences.sign-out-hint: You are Signed In to your Storyboarders.com account
preferences.additional-features-for-support: Here are some additional features for supporters.
preferences.add-watermark: Add watermark to exported images and video.
preferences.custom-watermark: Custom watermark image (leave blank for default)

print-window.pdf-intro: Your storyboard printed the way you like. Choose the format and either directly print or export it to PDF.
print-window.worksheet-intro: Draw thumbnail boards on this printed worksheet and magically import them back into your storyboarder file!

new-window.creation-title: There are 2 ways to create a new storyboard. Which would you like?
new-window.script-based-description:
If you are working on a story
with a script, you can specify the
script, and Storyboarder will help you board for each scene and
show you the script while you are boarding. Feel free to change the
script while boarding. Scripts can be in Fountain (.fountain)
or Final Draft (.fdx) format.
new-window.blank-description:
You can simply create a totally blank storyboard. Just make boards and draw. If you'd like to import your storyboard into a script
based one later, it's easy.

If you are just starting, why not create a new blank storyboard for fun?
new-window.aspect-description:
The aspect ratio defines the size of your boards.

2.39:1 is the widest, like what you would watch in a movie.
16:9 is what you would watch on a modern TV.
4:3 is what your grandpops watched back when screens flickered and programming was wholesome.

Please don't select vertical HD. We added it as a joke.
